album.full_title: Falling Out / Falling In - EP by Zolita

annotations:
Oh, Ashley
 I need you so badly
 ’Cause life is a bad dream

ZOLITA talks about how she needs Ashley because of how her life is a “bad dream” refrencing how society negatively treats her as a woman and a lesbian. Perhaps, she sees Ashley as a rock she can lean on, or a person that gives her motivation & inspiration to live; Ashley gives her comfort, and strength.

Oh, Ashley
 I need you so badly
 ’Cause life is a bad dream

ZOLITA talks about how she needs Ashley because of how her life is a “bad dream” refrencing how society negatively treats her as a woman and a lesbian. Perhaps, she sees Ashley as a rock she can lean on, or a person that gives her motivation & inspiration to live; Ashley gives her comfort, and strength.

So if lovin’ you kills me
 Yeah, I would die happy
 Oh, Ashley
 I’m yours if you’ll have me
 I’m sick it’s so sappy
 But if lovin’ you kills me
 Yeah, I would die happy

Before the 1970’s, homosexuality used to be seen and defined as a “mental disorder” and a “disease”

“I’m sick it’s so sappy. But if lovin' you kills me yeah I would die happy.”

May mean that if loving Ashley was a “deadly disease,” she would rather very much die happy.

 There are also a number of cases and reports containing the killings and mistreatments that people do to the LGBTQIA+ community. Lesbians, along with the rest of the community are still illegal in 70+ countries, some even punishable by death. So we can even say that the line:

“If loving you kills me yeah I would die happy”

 Is a statement of protest. That ZOLITA is willing to die for her identity, and for the girl she loves.

So if lovin’ you kills me
 Yeah, I would die happy
 Oh, Ashley
 I’m yours if you’ll have me
 I’m sick it’s so sappy
 But if lovin’ you kills me
 Yeah, I would die happy

Before the 1970’s, homosexuality used to be seen and defined as a “mental disorder” and a “disease”

“I’m sick it’s so sappy. But if lovin' you kills me yeah I would die happy.”

May mean that if loving Ashley was a “deadly disease,” she would rather very much die happy.

 There are also a number of cases and reports containing the killings and mistreatments that people do to the LGBTQIA+ community. Lesbians, along with the rest of the community are still illegal in 70+ countries, some even punishable by death. So we can even say that the line:

“If loving you kills me yeah I would die happy”

 Is a statement of protest. That ZOLITA is willing to die for her identity, and for the girl she loves.

So if lovin’ you kills me
 Yeah, I would die happy
 Oh, Ashley
 I’m yours if you’ll have me
 I’m sick it’s so sappy
 But if lovin’ you kills me
 Yeah, I would die happy

Before the 1970’s, homosexuality used to be seen and defined as a “mental disorder” and a “disease”

“I’m sick it’s so sappy. But if lovin' you kills me yeah I would die happy.”

May mean that if loving Ashley was a “deadly disease,” she would rather very much die happy.

 There are also a number of cases and reports containing the killings and mistreatments that people do to the LGBTQIA+ community. Lesbians, along with the rest of the community are still illegal in 70+ countries, some even punishable by death. So we can even say that the line:

“If loving you kills me yeah I would die happy”

 Is a statement of protest. That ZOLITA is willing to die for her identity, and for the girl she loves.

Your biggest fears my history
 And mine’s the thought of what could be

According to ZOLITA from her Sweety High Interview:

“I think it really captures the feeling you get before jumping into a relationship—and how scary it is to be vulnerable with someone in that way.”

The silver chain around your neck
 I hate myself when I think of it
 ’Cause when I do I’m a wreck
 Your name rings round in my head

As seen in the music video for Ashley, ZOLITA wears a silver necklace which was actually given to her by her childhood best friend Ashley which she kept until she grew older.

She hates that – that necklace gives her memories from when they were children since it reminds her of the fact that her & Ashley weren’t able to have a relationship to begin with, and she deeply regrets that.

She also misses Ashley very much and still loves her. Despite knowing that Ashley was actually getting married to someone else.

I know that one day you could hurt me
 And I will probably deserve it
 Maybe our best is less than perfect
 But I’m sure that this is worth it

ZOLITA talks about the fact that she knows Ashley could breakup with her and leave her in the future, she also mentions how “she deserves it” meaning she thinks that Ashley could’ve left because of something she could’ve done.

She also talks about how their relationship wasn’t “perfect,” but despite that, they were able to work through their problems and tried their best to make their relationship work; saying that all their efforts were “worth it” in the end.

If there’s a world with you and me
 Then there’s a world where you could leave

In here, ZOLITA is refrencing a branch of the Multiverse Theory called The Parallel Universe Theory:  A separate universe or world that coexists with our known universe but is very different from it. Commonly known as “a different dimension/reality.” As others would like to call it.

ZOLITA simply talks about how if in this reality they are together, there might be a reality where Ashley leaves her.

Oh, Ashley
 I need you so badly
 ’Cause life is a bad dream

ZOLITA talks about how she needs Ashley because of how her life is a “bad dream” refrencing how society negatively treats her as a woman and a lesbian. Perhaps, she sees Ashley as a rock she can lean on, or a person that gives her motivation & inspiration to live; Ashley gives her comfort, and strength.

description.plain:
“20 Questions” was first teased by Zolita on her TikTok account. In the video, Zolita explained the inspiration behind the song:

I don’t know if it’s just a me thing, or if a lot of people who’ve been cheated on have experienced this, but I felt a sick sense of power in that in between time where I knew the information and my partner didn’t know that I knew the information until I flipped it on them.

description.plain:
“Ruin My Life” is the sophomore single of American singer-songwriter, Zolita, third extended-play, Falling Out / Falling In, which is expected to be released in February 10, 2023, and will tell the highs and lows of a standard romantic relationship.

The track, in words of the artist, “is about that period of time when you fall in love with someone and it genuinely feels like nothing else matters. You start canceling plans, blowing off your friends, losing focus at work, and it may be unhealthy, but it feels so good. It’s about needing someone so badly that you wouldn’t mind if they ruined your life”.

You start canceling plans, blowing off your friends, losing focus at work, and it may be unhealthy, but it feels so good. description.plain:
“Shut Up and Cry” is the third track to Zolita’s debut album, Evil Angel. In the electronic-pop song, Zolita sings about being in an un-healthy relationship, and now telling her partner to “shut up and cry,” to end the chaos.

The song is an call-out on her former relationship stated in an post on Twitter:

In my last relationship, my girlfriend would start massive fights over really absurd things. I knew fighting with her was pointless because she was never able to empathize or see anyone else’s point of view. So shutting up and crying was really the only way to ever end a fight.

(Your love)1Embed

song.embed_content: Read “Holy” by Zolita on Genius
song.title: Holy

annotations:
Forgive me Father, I am weak
 And it’s not forgiveness that I seek

Catholic Christians have a practice of private confessionals where, people speak to the priest (called “Father” by some) and confess their sins in hopes for salvation.

Here, she seems to use the style of a confessional to admit helplessness to the woman she has fallen for. Yet she is unapologetic, especially in regards to her sexuality, for “It’s not forgiveness that” she seeks

I can fight but the devil wins
 And I will fall like a saint who sins

Homosexuality is often looked upon, especially by Christians, as a sin, and members of the lgbtq community are viewed as people who willfully sin. “I can fight but the devil wins” shows how helpless one is to their sexuality and how it truly isn’t a choice.
Drink my tears, I’m at your mercy
Drinking someone’s tears is often a symbol for being allowed to see their emotions, and letting them keep them inside of them. She’s at this girl’s mercy because of it.
